headline: Trump endorses Joe Lombardo in crowded GOP primary for Nevada governor
author: Tyler Olson
sentences: "After getting attacks from all sides on the airwaves, called out for hiding, ripped for having it both ways on immigration, and hours after a brutal editorial from the conservative Review-Journal on his lack of transparency and record of wasting taxpayer money, it's no surprise Lombardo is reaching out for a lifeline."

"Ton of respect for President Trump but it's obvious he gets advice from the wrong people sometimes," Heller said, "He also endorsed Mitt Romney and Liz Cheney.

"As Governor, Joe will fiercely Protect our under-siege Second Amendment, Oppose Sanctuary Cities, Support our Law Enforcement, Veto any Liberal Tax Increase, Protect Life, and Secure our Elections," Trump said in a statement.

Lombardo and other candidates in the GOP primary, including former Nevada Sen. Dean Heller, Reno lawyer Joey Gilbert, businessman Guy Nohra and North Las Vegas Mayor John Lee, also pressed for Trump's endorsement.
Former President Donald Trump Wednesday endorsed Nevada GOP gubernatorial candidate Joe Lombardo in a crowded Republican primary, further entrenching the Clark County sheriff as the front-runner.
"From his tough on crime policies to his unwavering support of law enforcement, I know that there has been no greater friend to veterans and police officers than President Trump," Lombardo said.
But Sisolak is considered an especially vulnerable Democrat governor due to how hard the pandemic hit the state and the political environment with President Biden's struggling approval rating.

GOP candidates are consistently attacking Sisolak for how his pandemic restrictions affected schoolchildren and the economy  taking a page out of Virginia Gov.
But in the wide field in which Lombardo was already considered at the top of the pack, the Trump backing could set the sheriff up to take on Democrat Gov.
"I'm ready to get to work restoring law and order, fixing our education system, and building a strong economy in our great state as your next governor."
"Our message is resonating, and we are gaining momentum daily as I earn the endorsements of Nevadans all across our state,' Nohra said.
Other Nevada GOP gubernatorial candidates downplayed the significance of Trump's endorsement or didn't publicly address it Wednesday.
"I look forward to continuing our tour in the days and weeks to come and will work hard to earn every vote as I have promised."
"It's clear Joe Lombardo's campaign is hitting the panic button," Sisolak for governor spokesperson Reeves Oyster said.
"Joe Lombardo is the leader Nevada needs, and he has my Complete and Total Endorsement for Governor!"
